title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behaviour participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behaviour may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Small typos grammatical errors documentation may edited directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. E.g. edit roxygen2 comment .R file R/, .Rd file man/.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: make substantial pull request, always file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s problem. ’ve found bug, create associated issue illustrate bug minimal reproducible example.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look GitHub Actions build status making changes. README contain badges continuous integration services used package. require tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s).

title: Authors and Citation
text: Thierry Onkelinx. Author, maintainer.            Research Institute Nature Forest (INBO) . Copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Onkelinx, Thierry (2024) watervogelanalysis: Analysis Wintering Birds. Version 0.4.0. https://inbo.github.io/watervogelanalysis/
code: @Manual{,   title = {watervogelanalysis: Analysis of the Wintering Birds. Version 0.4.0},   author = {Thierry Onkelinx},   year = {2024},   url = {https://inbo.github.io/watervogelanalysis/},   abstract = {Volunteers count 167 species of the wintering waterbirds in Flanders at over 1100 wetland site since the winter of 1991-1992. This R package assists the analysis of those records. First it imports the relevant data from the databank and stores that in an analysis data repository. Then it prepares the analysis objects in the format of the 'n2kanalysis' package. Those objects are sent off to fit, either of a local machine or an AWS EC2 instance. Finaly we generate a technical report on the results.},   keywords = {wintering waterbird, birds directive, monitoring}, }

title: Analysis of the Wintering Birds
text: watervogelanalysis package imports data Flemish Walloon monitoring schemes wintering birds. Prepares analysis datasets runs analysis.

text: location_file file details location visit_file file details visits location species_file file species data_file file observed species visit path directory files stored walloon_repo git_repository object Walloon source data strict metadata changes. strict = FALSE overwrites data metadata warning listing changes, strict = TRUE returns error leaves data metadata . Defaults TRUE.

code: prepare_dataset(   scheme_id,   raw_repo,   result_channel,   walloon_repo,   flemish_channel,   develop = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   first_year = 1992,   latest_year = as.integer(format(Sys.time(), "%Y")) )

title: Prepare the raw datasets and save them to the git repository — prepare_dataset
text: scheme_id id scheme raw_repo git_repository object write output result_channel open RODBC connection results database walloon_repo git_repository object Walloon source data flemish_channel DBI connection Flemish database develop logical. Indicate whether use development database TRUE production database. verbose Display progress bar TRUE (default) first_year first winter import. defaults 1992 latest_year latest winter import. Winter 2019 defined 2018-10-01 2019-03-31. Defaults winter prior last firth July. 2019-06-30 becomes 2018, 2019-07-01 becomes 2019.

title: Read the Flemish observations from a species — read_observation
text: data.frame observations. function returns observations based parent locations. Following rules apply combination parent location, year month. parent location observation, return observation. child location observation, return sum counts. neither parent child location observations, counts missing. Complete = 1 indicates entire location surveyed. case child locations, child locations surveyed full. Complete = 0 indicates location partially surveyed.
